issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Handle IllegalStateException in Async Scheduling mode of CapacityScheduler

This message was automatically generated.

Nice catching, thanks [~Tao Yang] for patch and detailed analysis. 

Patch generally looks good, only one minor comment:

Instead of using {{RmContainer().equals}}, it should be enough to use {{==}} to compare two instances, correct?
Sorry to add one more comment, [~Tao Yang], is there any other way to avoid adding the new method to CapacityScheduler?

bq. It's necessary to add new method if spy on app attempt. I'll try to find another way to test this problem, for example, spy on CapacityScheduler instance
Or you can extend CapacityScheduler and add the method in the test case, it's better to avoid test-only method to production code.
Updated the patch without adding new method to CapacityScheduler. Thanks [~leftnoteasy] for your suggestion, it's fine to only change the spy target for the test case.
